item.title: Skype for iPad is Here - TNW Apple

item.content:encoded: Skype for iPad is Now Available http://tnw.co/ofAjWk by @Zee Finally you can do away with the oversized iPhone version of Skype on your iPad because the official Skype for iPad app is finally available for download. item.title: AFP Wisconsin ballots have late return date - David Catanese - POLITICO.com
item.description: The fliers, obtained by POLITICO, ask solidly Democratic voters to return ballots for the Aug. 9 election to the... http://fb.me/AWoT4mq4
item.content:encoded: The fliers, obtained by POLITICO, ask solidly Democratic voters to return ballots for the Aug. 9 election to the... http://fb.me/AWoT4mq4 Americans for Prosperity is sending absentee ballots to Democrats in at least two Wisconsin state Senate recall districts with instructions to return the paperwork after the election date. The fliers, obtained by POLITICO, ask solidly Democratic voters to return ballots for the Aug. 9 election to the city clerk "before Aug. 11." A Democrat on the ground in Wisconsin said the fliers were discovered to be hitting doors in District 2 and District 10 over the weekend. "These are people who are our 1's in the voterfile who we already knew.  They ain't AFP members, that's for damn sure," the source said. One flier was discovered in Hudson, Wisc. where Democrat Shelly Moore is attempting to upend GOP State Sen. Sheila Harsdorf in District 10; the other was found in Kaukauna, where Democrat Nancy Nusbaum is challenging Sen. Robert Cowles in District 2. "If they're targeting for Aug. 16, they're hundreds and hundreds of miles off," said the Democratic activist who has been on the ground in Madison for months.  "This has nothing to do with either Democratic incumbent up on August 16th." The absentee trickery comes just as AFP has purchased $150,000 in ad time in Green Bay, Milwaukee and Madison to boost GOP candidates. Correction: An earlier version of this post misreported that a flier was found in Milwaukee. It was actually discovered in Kaukauna.     Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: politico.com

item.content:encoded: Data Center MarketPl Report: Google Uses About 900,000 Servers: Have Google watchers been overestimating the num... http://bit.ly/nDLlpa Have Google watchers been overestimating the number of servers in the company's data center network?
